snippet: Facing a deadline of midnight on Sunday, the California governor signed legislation on topics ranging from health care to immigrant rights to corporate taxation.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown, facing a deadline of midnight on Sunday, signs dozens of bills into law over the weekend, while vetoing dozens more; the most explosive bill allows young illegal immigrants who qualify for the new federal work-permit program to obtain driver's licenses.
lead_paragraph: Facing a deadline of midnight on Sunday, the California governor signed legislation on topics ranging from health care to immigrant rights to corporate taxation.

headline.seo: Gov. Jerry Brown of California Signs Dozens of Bills
headline.main: Bills Signed in California in a Flurry
headline.print_headline: Bills Signed In California In a Flurry
